SEARCH
Module PSP24
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards

Class PlayableCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards.PlayableCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard, InitialCard, ResourceCard
public abstract class PlayableCard extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract class that represents a card that can be played in the game.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayableCard

      public PlayableCard(int cardID, int numCorners, boolean isFront, CardType cardType, CornerLabel TLCorner, CornerLabel TRCorner, CornerLabel BRCorner, CornerLabel BLCorner)
      Constructs a PlayableCard with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      cardID - the unique identifier for the card.
      numCorners - the number of corners on the card.
      isFront - the side of the card (true if front, false if back).
      cardType - the type of the card.
      TLCorner - the label for the top-left corner.
      TRCorner - the label for the top-right corner.
      BRCorner - the label for the bottom-right corner.
      BLCorner - the label for the bottom-left corner.

  • Method Details

    • getCardID

      public int getCardID()
      Retrieves the unique identifier for the card.
      Returns:
      The card's ID.

      public int getNumCorners()
      Retrieves the number of corners on the card.
      Returns:
      The number of corners.

      public boolean isFront()
      Checks if the card is front-facing.
      Returns:
      true if the card is front-facing, false otherwise.

    • getCornerContent

      public String getCornerContent(int corner)
      Retrieves the content of the specified corner of a PlayableCard.
      Parameters:
      corner - position of the corner: 0 TLCorner, 1 TRCorner, 2 BRCorner, 3 BLCorner
      Returns:
      The content of the specified corner as a string.

    • getCornerContent

      public abstract List<String> getCornerContent()
      Retrieves the content of the corners of the card as a list of strings. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses such as GoldCard to provide specific behavior.
      Returns:
      A list containing the gold corner content strings.

    • getVictoryPoints

      public abstract int getVictoryPoints()
      Retrieves the victory points associated with the card. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      The number of victory points.

    • getNumResources

      public abstract int getNumResources()
      Retrieves the total number of resources on the card. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      The number of resources on the card.

    • getSymbol

      public abstract SymbolType getSymbol()
      Retrieves the symbol type associated with the card, if any. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      The symbol type of the card, or null if no symbol is present.

    • hasSymbol

      public abstract boolean hasSymbol()
      Checks if the card has a symbol. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      true if the card has a symbol, false otherwise.

      public abstract ResourceType getMainResource()
      Retrieves the main resource associated with the card. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      The main resource of the card.

      A list containing the placement condition resources.

    • isPointsCondition

      public abstract boolean isPointsCondition()
      Checks if the card has a points condition. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      true if the card has a points condition, false otherwise.

    • isCornerCondition

      public abstract boolean isCornerCondition()
      Checks if the card has a corner condition. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      true if the card has a corner condition, false otherwise.

    • getSymbolCondition

      public abstract SymbolType getSymbolCondition()
      Retrieves the symbol condition associated with the card, if any. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses.
      Returns:
      The symbol condition of the card, or null if no symbol condition is present.

    • toString

      public abstract String toString()
      Retrieves a string representation of the card. This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses to provide specific details about the card.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the card.

    • convertToEmoji

      public String convertToEmoji(String input)
      Converts a string representation of a resource type into its corresponding emoji. This method supports converting specific resource types used in the game into emoji symbols.
      Parameters:
      input - The string representation of the resource type to convert.
      Returns:
      The corresponding emoji symbol as a string, or "E" if no matching emoji is found.
